attributes.action: Publish government spending, and have full transparency on how money is spent.
attributes.additional_details: We would like to then see what the near £800 billion are spent on by the UK government. Then allow an independent and unbiased review by the British people that pay these taxes to discover where all of the money is being divided up into. With the cost of living going up and the lack of pay rises. We believe it is only right that we see the same level of transparency we are held to as small business owners or individuals when applying for financial institutions or being investigated.
attributes.background: As times are changing the UK banks, Small business are all required to show digital transactions for a multitude of reasons. For vetting, tax purposes and show full transparency on how our personal money is spent.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Government already publishes accounts for the UK public sector, which are available here: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/whole-of-government-accounts

It's not clear what changes you want to be made to how these accounts are currently reported. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
